Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2012 11:37PM Luke22_42 wrote: I would agree with the others. No reason to sound the alarm just yet. Inform your parents about the spot, but try not to self diagnose just yet. I've done that with myself and my kids. I don't want to do that with something this serious, but you do need to be informed and have it checked out. Praying it's nothing to worry over for you anymore! Let us know how things turn out.
Posts.Title: terrified.. how to talk about this with family members thedarkknight BikerLee

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2012 11:38AM Luke22_42 wrote: Thank you both. What they are telling me is that there was a known fibroadenoma and they feel that they came in from a different angle or something and picked up on it. However, there's nothing even remotely suspicious about it. The BS said we will check with US again in 3-4 months. I can live with that.

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 09:44AM Luke22_42 wrote: MamaMiss, Thank you so much! Sorry to hear that you're on this roller coaster, too. Praying for as painless biopsy as possible for you, quick recovery time, and benign results. Have a blessed day and rest my friend!
Posts.Title: Biopsy 6-18, Now I'm Waiting... Luke22_42 Luke22_42

Posts.Content: Luke22_42 wrote: My biopsy went well even though it started a bit odd. Has anyone ever had a suspicious area on an US show up that initially started the need for a biopsy disappear in a follow-up US? Well, that's what happened. The one I was concerned about the most didn't show up, but they had discovered a spot on my other breast in doing the follow-up. That is the one we biopsied instead of the one which first showed as suspicious. Anyway, all is well just sore and swollen. I should have results by Wednesday. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy 6-18, Now I'm Waiting... Luke22_42 Luke22_42

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2012 01:07AM Luke22_42 wrote: Hang in there and try to be positive. It sounds like you have a wonderful support group at home. I'll be in your shoes in a little over a week. My biopsy is scheduled for June 18. I've discovered a sense of peace over the last little bit. I've looked at so many things to educate myself. I want to know all that I can. My mom was diagnosed a little over a year ago. She thinks it was from her hormones. Doctors won't confirm. I just need to know and move forward. Sending warm thoughts your way.
Posts.Title: mammo again then a sonogram now need biopsy mommy2myboys Sommer43

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2012 12:39PM Luke22_42 wrote: I read the mammogram report that was done when the US was. It shows that there is no dominant mass, architechtural distortion or other abnormalities identified. Although it says that by US there is a mass in the right breast. I know I have a fibroadenoma in the left breast. It's scary that things don't show up on the mammograms. I'm extra cautious since my mom was diagnosed with BC a year ago. Thank you all for your posts. This is a great place to get support from others.
